Great battery life, excellent camera, and the right size for me. Also chose this due to upcoming Google storage changes.

A great phone all around. While it may no longer hold the title of king for the camera(Samsung 21U holds that title now), the phone itself is amazing. It's very responsive, no bloatware like Samsung and LG phones. The pixel 5 has a fantastic OLED screen that really makes colors stand out and of course, the blackest black for the best contrast ratio. 
  
  Looking forward to the Pixel 5 XL/Pro whatever they call it. Hopefully they will get some better hardware instead of the older stuff they keep using.

This is my first Pixel phone and I'm very happy with it. Good to get rid of the Samsung bloat after several years with a Galaxy. Battery life is good and camera is excellent. Haven't seen any issues with the processor. The main difference I noticed is the speaker behind the screen rather than a cut-out. Takes some getting used to but far from an issue. The screen color is very rich and Android 11 runs like it is intended to. Also a very light phone with an aluminum back rather than glass.
Great phone, love the Pixel concept and google platform. Fast and functional.
To save $150 off the list price well worth it. It comes with the Same Warranty you can't beat that.
Underrated sleek phone. Runs so smooth. Wayyyy better than the Samsung lineup. Wish the camera was a bit better though.
No better phone for running a pure version of Android. I had a Samsung galaxy s10 before this phone and hated all of the non Android interruptions from Samsung.
I love this phone. I have been an avid Pixel user since P1. The P5 size is PERFECT.

Great phone. Not overly expensive and pretty has all the flagship qualities that a daily user would care for. Love the Pixel Imprint because Face ID with masks on nowadays is worthless. Only two things I wish Google did better on was speakers and 4k resolution support.

I'm a first time Pixel owner and the experience is so refreshing. Out of the box the phone is just so simple. I'm not fighting with samsung phones any longer. I don't want junk software installed. No facebook, instagram, twitter, alternative web browsers, app stores, or antivirus. What you get is an android phone with the correct default apps for things you want to do. Messages, email, etc are all built in google suite apps and work perfectly. Messages in fact is so powerful now because you can pull up your texts via web browser on any PC. When I'm at my computer desk I don't even need to touch my phone and it's so much easier to type and respond to clients who prefer SMS via the computer. I used to have a separate google voice number just for doing this, but now I no longer need to maintain that extra phone number. 
  
  The newest OS also has built in smart device shortcuts anchored on the power button, and because that makes using smart devices so easy I've added additional smart plugs and lights to my home. I truly feel like this phone has changed the way I operate daily with the smart device integration. Also google assistant is good, like REALLY GOOD. I no longer set alarms or timers manually. I tell google to do it for me. It saves me so much time, and I'm amazed by how much I can accomplish hands free. 
  
  The only complaint I have at all is that the ear speaker is under the glass which takes some getting used to and is not loud enough in some environments (like driving with loud road noise). This is easily remedied by using a bluetooth earpiece, and let's be honest most people have those if you truly want to do anything hands free so the ear speaker becomes a non issue.

At first glance, you might think the Pixel 5 is a step back in some ways from the Pixel 4/4 XL. Technically you'd be correct on some fronts. But in actual usage, the Pixel 5 speeds along just as well and in some cases better. The camera hasn't really improved when it comes to still photography (although some would call the wide angle lens an improvement over the telephoto), but that still keeps it towards the top of the pile compared to other smartphone cameras. Video has gotten slightly better, but it still doesn't match up to its competitors. Battery life is fantastic, and in these pandemic times, the fingerprint sensor is a welcome change. 
  
  If you're looking for a solid, pure Android experience with great battery life and a fantastic camera, you've found it right here.

For a $599 phone, it is amazing. I stepped up from a Pixel 2 XL and this has much better battery, I have gotten 3 days of my "very light" use, 2 days from my "normal" use, and a full day out of my "heavy" use. The Pixel 5 also has a much smoother screen (90hz refresh rate) that you can tell the difference when scrolling through stuff. The phone overall is smaller that my Pixel 2 XL which took a few days to get use to, especially when typing on the virtual keyboard but since I use swiftkey's keyboard, I was able to enlarge the keyboard slightly from what I typically have it set at, and now all is good. Keep in mind, even though the overall phone size is smaller, the screen size was almost identical to my last phone due to the very small bezel, just a different aspect ratio, no longer 16x9 but now more narrow. I am not the biggest fan of the punchhole front camera, but it has stayed out of the way thanks to the oversized status bar at the top. Which, by the way, is a waste of space, the status bar is twice as tall as it use to be which is to cover the area of the front camera. I wish they could have moved the camera up further allowing the status bar to be normal size. The back cameras are great, and using the wide angle lens for the first time in a narrow room, at first made the picture have a fish eyed look. But to my surprise, the phone adjusted the picture after taken and squared the room back up to look normal without distortion - very impressive (picture attached). Now they need to include all 3 cameras like most other flagship phones have. While I don't play games on my phone, everything else is super fast and you would never know it doesn't have the highest end processer. 5G was not that impressive, but that is due to Verizon not the phone. Maybe one day we'll see faster speeds. Love having wireless charging again (my Samsung Galaxy S6 had it, and boy did I miss it on my Pixel 2 XL), I use wireless charging to save the USB C port from being overly used which will provide a longer life span without charging issues. Be sure to get a 14 or 15 watt wireless charger so you can take advantage to the faster wireless charging speeds. My biggest gripe is the transfer process to a new phone, Google needs to step up their game and when doing a full transfer of the apps, should sign all apps into your accounts. Very few apps auto signed in, and I had to manually sign-in, get 2-step verification codes, reset passwords, and even locked myself out of a few accounts. That process takes too long, and is a pain. Lastly, I love the sage green color, I have a clear case and have had compliments on the color which at times looks turquoise.

My last phone was a pixel 2 XL and I definitely miss having the two speakers on the front of the phone. I wish the pixel 5 had front facing speakers. Everything else I love about the phone. And this phone cost me way less than my pixel 2 XL 3 years ago.
Great camera, great software experience, always first in line for Google’s newest software, all in a small, compact design.

Pro:
  Clear voice quality. Lighter than previous phones. Comfortable to hold. 
  
  Con: Unable to use plug in ear phones.
Pixel 5 has been used for a month. Works great. Photo optics are excellent. Customer Service at Best Buy was also great!
good phone for the price! Good an responsive also!

I have been very happy with the Pixel 5, I prefer the software experience on the Pixel phone, no carrier or manufacturer bloat ware on the phone. The phone runs very smooth and the camera takes great pictures. I was a little concerned that it had the 765G chip and not the 865 but I can honestly say the phone is plenty fast with the 765. 5G speeds with TMobile have been good. Very satisfied with my purchase.
Staff Will and Allie are very helpful and knowledgeable

I've had some previous Pixel phone versions and my last one started having battery issues so I upgraded to the Pixel 5. This phone has some nice new features as expected from Google and also a Terrific Battery Life that can sometimes last me 3 days. The camera has been great as expected and still have unlimited photo storage. The phone however is not without minor bugs that need to be worked out, not a big issue since I know from past my Google phones these issues will be fixed with one of the many Android updates that Google releases to keep he Pixels running smoothly.

excellent phone nice camera quality, good battery life, and I really like it
Phone was fine. No problems. Liked android 11. Problem was I missed my stylus. Returned it. I will upgrade to the Note 20 5g Ultra when the price drops below $1,000.

However, if you want a pure Google experience and you aren't playing Fortnite on your phone, this will still be a good phone for you. You won't beat the camera for the price either.
So far I love my phone. I was mainly looking for a phone that had a good camera for pictures. This phone takes amazing pictures and it also has many options to edit also.
Extremely easy to use and at the price point, certainly better value than the Samsung or Apple. Would buy it again if offered a discount.

Pros:

  - Stock Google Android OS is great
  - Camera, GREAT

  - Price: Somewhat high for lesser specs

Average phone. The only good thing about this phone is pure android and the camera, the rest is average. The worst is the CPU. You feel the lag and when you are left with 10-15% battery the lag is unbearable. For the price not worth. Wait until it goes on sale.

Only issue is that edges of screen is sometimes not responsive (the hardware is fine, but sometimes software glitches and doesn't register taps at the edges). I am completely satisfied with the Pixel 5. I bought it to replace the original Pixel I'd used since 2016. It is intuitive, runs straight Android (no bloat-ware), takes excellent photos, and runs 5g. It also cost several hundred dollars less than a number of other flagship phones. I highly recommend the Pixel 5.

If you can get this phone at $550 or less, buy it. This phone is great but a little overpriced. In a world of top tier spec $1k+ phones, it's nice to see one manufacture trying to maximize value.
Excellent phone. Screen isn't quite as bright/vibrant as my pixel 3 but that's a minor inconvenience considering the phone is less expensive.
the phone I like, it fits in my hand and feels completely different from previous Google phones, thanks bestbuy shipped very quickly and carefully.
My daughter is very happy with her new phone, easy to use

Great phone! No frills, just good performance and get-it-first Google updates. Camera is good and the battery is good, too. Not the fastest at charging, but fast enough for me. Switched from a Samsung S9+. I'm definitely satisfied. Screen size of perfect IMO.
The Pixel is back. No face unlock gimmicks and poor battery like. No need for a high-end Snapdragon Processor to chew up the battery. It's the same pixel that you've come to love.
Great camera, takes awesome pictures even in low light. Good speed on Verizon 5G and LTE. Enjoying the integration with all my Google home devices.
The Google Pixel 5 is the finest phone I have owned. Fast, smooth scrolling, superb photos, right size.

Switch over from an iphone 11 pro max. I love the size and overall software experience compared to iphone. I love how the finger sensor works in a time during covid-19. Love the Pixel 5. Size is perfect. Comfortable to hold and slips easily into pocket. The operating system is intuitive and easy use. The screen resolution is beautiful. Doesn't have tons of junk on it I don't need or want. Haven't used the camera much yet, but so far seems very good.

When the Pixel 5 arrived, I went through the usual process of onboarding the new device. If you've never experienced migrating from one Pixel to another, I can tell you there is no easier experience to be found. Connect the phones with the included cable and walk through the wizard. In the end, you'll have every app and account configuration on your new Pixel that you had on the old Pixel. It's seamless, painless, and effortless.
touch not sensitive, sometimes freezes. overall its average
Great phone! The camera is second to none. And since it's running pure android you always have the latest updates to keep your phone running smoothly and keep it secure.
Excellent phone, my wife loved it, handy and really nice.

I have been android user for a long time. Normally I go for the top of the line Samsung like the S20 5g which turned out to be a huge fail. 
  Its fast, will run the latest games but had terrible issue with autofocus and could not take a clear picture and dropped wifi all the time. 
  
  So now rather than looking for specs, I was looking for what is the most polished experience out that will take great photos and run great because honestly I really dont game on my phone. I need it to work, be reliable and be best camera out. 
  
  Well from what I read latest Iphone and pixel 5 take best photos out and some say pixel 5 is better. 
  
  All I can say is WOW. On paper if you just read specs, this seams lower end with memory compared to flag ship samsung and CPU. 
  
  However the experience you get with Google Pure android is night and day difference. The Camera just works and takes some of the best photos I have ever seen. 
  
  Everything is lighting fast even though specs are lower than samsung phone I came from. This is due to Samsungs UI interface is so slow and just bogs the phone down. 
  
  WIFI is top notch, and the Google assistant call screening feature is a GOD SEND! 
  
  Everything about this phone is amazing and I cant say really anything wrong with it. 
  
  On paper I know I am missing out on top CPU and has less memory but in real life use its faster than top of the line samsungs so please try this phone you will be happy you did and this is how ALL ANDROID PHONES SHOULD BE!

I am always the first to get the new pixel every year desipite it's price drop within a month theoretically. This year is no different. Even there are bad things about the new mid range chipset. It actually handles daily task surprisingly well. Battery life is outstanding compare to my previous pixel 4xl. Just praying for a more premium pixel next year. Overall, pretty satisfied about the result. The only downside for me is the cutting edge vibration motor, it is dramatically worse than the one in pixel 4xl.

My first pixel phone and I'm very disappointed with it. From call audio cutting off to poor display performance I don't recommend this to anyone. I passed my two week return policy so kinda stuck with it now. The only good thing is the finger print reader in the back.

The battery can last for 2 days for me in one charge (though I'm not a heavy user). The sound is a little bit soft from the top under-screen speaker. But overall I'm pretty satisfied with this phone.
Great phone. Kt took me a while to get used to it but im liking it a lot. I loved the unlock button in the back.
This phone got a lot of flack for not having an 865 processor bit the 765g with stock Android and 90htz refresh rate is so clean and smooth. Got a good open box deal too
Great phone, screen is beautiful. This is my 4th pixel highly recommend
Nice phone just wish they’d made a pixel 5XL. Other than that I love the phone.
Have been using the phone for more than a month now. The Camera is pretty good and battery life is decent.
Smaller size compare to the older model but hey great camera and battery life can't beat that and definitely can't beat the price.

Recently switched from using LG smartphones for the past four years so figuring out a new phone from a different company is always fun. You get to learn different features that you may or may not have had on a different smart phone.
Great phone great upgrade from my iphone 7. Super easy to use and super customizable.
Great Phone. Have no complaints about it. The color is also really good.

I absolutely love my Pixel 5, and had only upgraded because I accidentally dropped my Pixel 3a XL in water. Google's clean simplification of the android operating system is visually pleasing and easy to use, and the phone runs any app I have downloaded well. I highly recommend Pixel phones, whether you are choosing the 5 or another model.
Camera takes fantastic pictures. Really works in all lighting conditions. Great alternative to dropping a grand on Samsung.
Great device, great deal on it too. Thank you Best Buy for the device!

Just made the switch over from Samsung Galaxy to Google, absolutely love my new Pixel 5! It has none of the stupid bloatware that Samsung carries, easy to use, great camera and easily integrates with other Google applications.
Excellent phone fir tge Average consumer who doesn't need ir want to pay for extras that are not necessary for them.

Great phone. I bought this for my wife and she loves it. I will definitely be getting this for myself also. Love the smaller profile yet maximum screen.

Image processing is a little bit slower on the Pixel 5 due to processor but not a huge difference. Camera quality still remains the same. Love the ultra wide angle camera.

Also, I feel like it's faster than my iPhone 11, and the assistant is much more responsive. Also, I use it for normal everyday uses, and I have yet to have the phone die on me. Usually it's no less than 50% when I plug it in at night. One bonus I like is that it has reverse charging so I am able to use it to charge other devices wireless :)

Great phone. All the reviews are right. No bloatware on this phone. The battery has lasted me 3 days on light/moderate use. Great screen. I have no issues with this phone and hope it lasts a long time.
Easy to set up. Price is reasonable. My wife loves it.
Worth the cost to get 5G, Water resistance, light weight , fast , repairable, features comparable to other high-end phones
Great simple phone. No gimmicks, just a pixel with a very nice camera.
Great camera! Phone size is smaller than I'm used to but actually much more easier to handle. Overall a great phone for a reasonable price.
Great phone and works well. HW looks and feels good but pricey for the internals. However,Google making real efforts to unify experience on Android.

Good product I recommend!

It was a great phone until just after the return period expired, the volume of the speaker started fluctuating wildly. Doesn't matter whether it's being used as a phone or in any app; the volume will just randomly vary, oscillating over time. For example, say I set the volume at 50% on the phone's visual volume control. The volume indicator doesn't change, just the sound coming from the speaker drops to maybe as low as about 10% and then ten seconds or so later it surges up to somewhere higher than I set it. It also changes in tone -- when the volume drops it also loses all treble and sounds far away and muffled. For that reason I'm guessing it might even be a thermal issue pushing the speaker components around. Oh well, sad that it happened after the return period. This is the fourth phone in six years that I will have to pursue a warranty for. Samsung, LG/Google, Motorola, and now Google again.

Really enjoy the new phone, it took time to get used to the new features but that is expected. However the website did glitch when I first started the check out process and made it seem like the phone was out of stock and I couldn't purchase it. Otherwise no issues and happy with purchase.
It is not good regarding to the price and features

great basic phone. That is not a dig, it is the truth. This does what you need, and that's it. This gets updates the minute they exist... some phones take many months to get updates.

Great phone! I've had three of the five pixel phones and this one is probably in the top two. Takes great photos

I loved the pixel 4a because of the size, the price and the fact that it is just a well-rounded phone that does most things well. I wasn't impressed by the battery though. 
  
  The pixel 4a 5g was even better, with a much improved battery and slightly better camera. The pixel 4a 5g is an incredible phone and with the current discounts is the best value for money in terms of Pixel phones, maybe the best value period. The size is what led me to the Pixel 5, it was personally just too big for my hands. 
  
  Ok, so the Pixel 5 is an excellent phone. The size is perfect for me. The battery is phenomenal, it has a great camera, a beautiful screen, and the sound is better than ok despite some complaints in various reviews. It ticks every box and after a few days use, I haven't experienced anything that stands out as a glaringly obvious fault.

got this after having an iphone for so long
  love love love it as my business phone. works so much better with apps.
Awesome phone, fast enough for everyday tasks and no bloatware to slow it down. The 90Hz refresh display, wireless charging, and water resistance are icing on the cake.

Google has decided to ditch the high specs of other flagships, and instead take a middle of the road approach in order to make the their phones more affordable. Do not let that fool you though, as you would be hard pressed to notice unless you are a power user who pushes their device to the bleeding edge. The phone feels quick and fluid, and everything just works. Of course, you are also getting the pixels great camera as well. The camera is basically the same as the one found on the 4/4XL, though they replaced the telephoto lens with a wide angle. I do hope the next phone finally upgrades the sensor, but it certainly still one of the best camera's on the market. The phone feels solid, and the coating on the aluminum frame gives it some grip. If you want a lightweight android experience without all the bloat you get with other phones, then look no further.
Love the phone with amazing battery life! Screen is smooth and phone is fast. An upgrade from my 3xl

Great Android Smartphone with a perfect size and feature set. Android 11 is awesome and the pixel 5 showed it off quite nicely although the build quality should be better at this price point. This phone is the perfect Android smartphone as long as you get rid of Google...

Clean Android is the best. Camera is awesome. Design is simple yet makes sense. Small size but the screen is big enough. Battery life is great, last all day long. Processor is powerful enough for anything I throw at it. Screen is sharp and crisp. Really a great smart phone.

I got this phone as part of the Best Buy Tech Insider program in order to review. I switched from my Samsung Note10+ and although it isn't necessarily more powerful, the Pixel 5 feels faster and more powerful especially when it is connected to a 5G network. 
  
  The size is ok, much more compact than the Note10+ which fits nicely in my pocket. However, even though the screen is smaller, it isn't that noticeable. It is bright and crisp with vibrant colors and detail. 
  
  The camera is where the Pixel 5 really shines. It takes such high quality photos that it's hard to tell which ones I shot on my phone and which ones I shot on my DSLR. 
  
  Overall I really love the Pixel 5 and don't think that I will switch back to a Samsung phone any time soon.
I love the size of this phone for one hand use, I’m a world nowadays of huge phones, I also love the material it feels good in the hand.

I would consider myself a phone geek. I choose specifications over all else when deciding my next phone purchase. At least so I thought. The Pixel 5 doesn't come with the lastest processor from the time it was launched, but Google is a software company. They know how to optimize phones. No stutters, lags, or hiccups to report. The battery is the best battery I've ever tested. Consistently get 7-8 hours of screen on time and I make it to bed with 20% left after watching YouTube, scrolling twitter and Instagram, podcast and music streaming with bluetooth etc. The camera is phenomenal. For stills, it's comparable to the iphone 12. In video there is a little warping which gets annoying but only in shaky situations. I have never loved a phone this much except for my beloved OnePlus 5. If you're on the fence, I would say give it a try. For all the phone you're getting with the price, there aren't many better deals

People at the store were not willing to show me how to use the item or transfer my connections. I am still figuring how everything works. I would probably rate it higher when I completely figure it out and can use all capabilities.

I am frustrated they don't offer an XL. I use google native apps for many things so an IPHONE was not working and find the wireless charging helpful at bedtime.

I switched from iPhone and couldn't be happier with my decision. This phone works as smooth as an iPhone but with a battery life and better design. I always thought android was laggy and can never be up to par with iPhone but Google has proven me wrong with this pixel series. Hands down one of the best phones out there. 100/100 will recommend.

I have owned most the of the Pixel and Nexus phones, so there may be a little bias. I like the pure experience, after using a Moto for half a year it was great getting back to a Pixel phone. Great camera, good software experience, OK battery but that is the price right now for 5G... I really like the screen, and keep coming back for more.
Love this phone, I find it hard to kill the battery after a full day of use, and the size is just perfect
I'm not impressed, it's no different than other pixels as far as features, they changed how you get to everything which is confusing if you still have other pixels and it's not really very big
I love my Pixel 5. 128GB, great photos and videos. Only downside it tends to be warm when running too many apps, but manageable. Plus the value was great compare to others.
Best android phone on the market. This looks and feels great. Great camara and battery life. Easy to transfer all my apps etc.. from one android phone to another.
The battery life is amazing and the 90hz display allows everything to work smoothly. All iPhones should be jealous.

The Pixel 5 is one of the best smartphones available, and one of the best Pixel phones to date. The best in Google software experience, amazing battery life (easily 1-2 days, no question) and a sharp, vivid screen that fills out an easy-to-hold body make for an excellent smartphone experience. Oh, and the camera is top-notch.
Love my new cellphone! Everything works perfectly except the speaker phone. I'm not sure if I need to adjust on settings. But everything else is wonderful.
It's 1G better than four, and the battery life is great.
I love this phone! It is very fast and the size is perfect. The cameras is by far the best I have used on a phone.
Great phone, not overpriced,still feels like a flagship phone
Great phone for most users. Good and affordable price. Good physical size. Easy to use.
Love pure google, coming from a samsung Galaxy s10, one thing though the in screen speaker is kind of muffled but other than that everything about this phone is perfect

This is a great smartphone, super fast, screen is great, you might have some trouble when it's sunny outside, there will be some glare. 
  Like other pixels the camera is great. 
  The sound is average, I don't like the phone vibration when you have your sound up. 
  Phone jack is out of it, I knew that before buying, but still, for the price was nice having one.
Fast and responsive, even without the "best chip" the loads of RAM probably help. Camera is great as always. Wireless charging works very well.

My 4th Pixel, after an untimely death of my 4XL (note: phones don't like saltwater...). Though I actually miss some features, primarily the ability to wave snooze my alarm in the morning, the size change is great, and the return of the fingerprint sensor is certainly welcome in the mask era. Still great UI, excellent camera, and always up to date. Not as many gimmicks as others, but still one of the smartest phones out there

I/m an Android phone user and have been for years. I've owned the original Pixel, Pixel 2 and Pixel 3. I skipped the Pixel 4 and just purchased the Pixel 5. I go with this phone because of the camera and the vanilla Android OS. I don't mind that the hardware is not premium because the software mostly makes up for it. I do think it's a little expensive for what the hardware is but what can you do.

So far so good, I switched over from the pixel 2. The controls are a little different so it takes a little to readjust to the new way of navigating the phone. Had the phone for a week, no problems so far. Does everything a smart phone is supposed to do.
Easy to navigate with ease, I bought mostly for the camera, have yet to check everything out but so far I'm enjoying my new phone,

It's a solid phone. doesn't have too many 'killer' features, but it is a great solid android phone. They could have thrown in a few 'wow' feature, like a higher processor, so some other high end specs, but in the end it turned into a great 'mid' tier phone. 
  If you want a phone with all of the features, check out Samsung, where their features are impressive. they won't give you the perk of the pixel experience. Samsung has come a long way since the s6 I had back in the day, and has improved the interface, but I perfer a more base android feel . 
  The screen and battery are amazing and I've had a great experiance with it so far. Cameras are always great, but should start upgrading them to complete with Apple and Sammy. 
  All in all I'm still pretty happy with this phone
  And with all phones, but one a case as they all tend to slip out of pockets( enven the smallish ones). The case has saved me a few times already. Maybe one of these days I can actually use the 5G aspect of it, as of right now,, I'm still getting pretty good 4G single and their new lower 5G high 4G hybread that they just rolled out.
I've been a fan of Google phones since the old g1. This is not a flagship phone but an affordable 5G device with wireless charging and one of the best cameras in the industry.
After using the Google Pixel 5 I know I'm a customer for life. Amazing camera and super user friendly.

This was my first choice in phones since I no longer support Samsung. My wife has the Pixel 3XL and she loves it. I really am impressed by this phone. It was easy to set up and move contacts over from my previous phone. Only wish it has expandable storage.
It took about 2 minutes total to set up, it's a good phone for those, looking for something simple.
What a beast of a phone at such great value! Screw you apple, always minting money from the iphone. It's a pleasure to use this product!
Overall an excellent priced phone. Phone has the perfect size to keep in pockets. Pictures are outstanding. Overall great phone.
Great looking phone that works perfectly! Good build quality
Not much had changed. Disappointed. Not a $700 phone.

Just bought this and unfortunately dropped it in the toilet. The whole phone got dunked in and covered with toilet water for like 2 seconds. The phone is water resistant and not waterproof. However it's pretty good, once I took my phone out it told me that it disabled the USBc so it wouldn't be damaged by the liquid inside. Once the liquid was removed and dried up, the notification disappeared and USBc worked againthe. Great phone.
The google pixel 5 is great. If you’re looking for something good and cheap I would recommend this smartphone.

Been a Samsung Galaxy user since the Fascinate and using my S7 for almost 5 years. A few hundred drops later it finally gave out and I purchased the Pixel 5 since all the Samsung phones were out of stock (low production due to COVID). So far, so good. Phone was inexpensive and has great battery life. Camera takes amazing pictures in the light but gets grainy in darker settings. Love the screen call feature so I can ignore the robo callers. Not much to say as of now and hopefully it lasts just as long as my S7.
Very solid phone, great camera, OK processor, more than ample storage, OK speakers. I would recommend this if you're due for an upgrade.
Love the user interface of google. Phone fits perfectly in my hands.

This is my third Google phone (formerly Nexus and Pixel 2 XL). As always, Android Vanilla works like a charm. In this short time of use, the only disadvantage I found is that it is not a high-end phone, it is somewhere in the middle and upper range. Not a very noticeable change coming from a Pixel 2 XL, I changed because my old pixel has a broken screen just above the front camera. I hope Google releases a high-end phone one day.
So far this phone has been great. The feel to the phone and the quality build is really good.

This phone has had some slight software issues. It wasn't ringing, it wasn't turning on silent during night time on based on the schedule I had set. The speaker quality as well is far worse and lower than my pixel 3.

Good smart phone for someone that doesn't want to pay for the $1000 flagships. Camera performs about the same as Pixel 4XL. Phone and fingerprint reader are a little bit glitchy. I expect these to be ironed out with subsequent updates.

This is the first time I've really been able to play around with a Google phone. I like the startup process and felt like I was asked for a lot less information compared to other phones. It was up and running fast and is super user friendly. It had a similar android feel but felt less cluttered with some of the normal bloat apps included. I appreciate the size of the phone and how it fits in my hand but the materials feel a little light to me. I like a little more solid feeling phone personally but I have a toddler who uses it and I am prone to dropping things. The screen is responsive and games and movies view nicely. I unfortunately live in a small town without 5G however the signal strength compared to my other phones just fine. The battery life was talked up quite a bit however with normal use it does seem to drain faster than I'd like. Sound quality and call quality compare to other name brand phones as well. I don't have any major complaints, this is a solid phone especially for the price.
Phone is easy to use and I specifically got it for the live caption. Works great.
Solid software makes up for every hardware shortcoming. The hole punch display and design regression from adding the fingerprint to the back and not the side is why it's 4 stars and not 5.

I returned the iphone 12 and bought this instead and I'm glad I did. The Pixel 5 is Great phone. Size is great and battery life is excellent and all of the Google features that's actually useable and not gimmicks ad don't forget about the quick updates, straight from google themselves. 
  
  The price could be about $100 less but it's still better than the high prices phones of Apple and Samsung.

Seems like a lateral move from the Pixel 4XL - Pros - way better battery life, lightweight, good feel about the phone
  
  Cons - Smaller screen than Pixel XL, not entirely sold on the 5G integration

Great smartphone, coming from a Pixel 3, the camera is still great, but with a larger screen and amazing battery life. The size is perfect, not too big and not too small, and the sorta sage color is very nice. The build quality is top and it feels great on the hand. After using it for a couple of weeks, performance has been good, don't even notice it doesn't have a top of the line processor. Overall an amazing smartphone.
Clear difference between 4g and 5g. Switched from a pixel 3. Only complaint is wish they had more color options.

Google New phone is more like a midrange in specs but man does it feel like a flagship. It's super speedy and the camera is amazing. The best... The battery life goes on for 7 plus hours screentime for me.

Speaker under screen is a little weird. Phone is very quick to respond. Gestures are a little weird to get use to. Overall is a great phone. New phone feeling wears off within a few days since it is pretty similar to previous versions.

pixel 5 has all the flagship goodies with a fraction of the price camera is reall awesome .. water resisitant .. wirless charging too.. snmooth 90hz.. display action and straigh google software updated the fastest
Got this during a sale, but overall, it's been a quality phone with decent enough specs compared to other same-gen phones. Might not be as worth it at full retail price, though.
It is really great product from google and best buy pick up service was awesome.
Good functional phone, photos are really neat. I recommend I'd you are looking for a small device
Solid phone. Great camera and battery life. Phone processing is adequate. I wish the speakers were better and call quality is just average. No major complaints, meets my needs.

Battery life is excellent. The camera is incredible. I bought this phone for the astrophotography capability and it blows me away each time I used it. The display is nice. Coming from a phone with a 60hz display to this 90hz display made a bigger difference than I was expecting. Android 11's gestures has made moving from iOS to Android pretty simple as they're intutitve and familiar. It's a great phone at a great price. Not having a processor on the bleeding edge of speed and capability is a plus here. Day to day performance is smooth, fast, and reliable. Timely Android and security updates might be the biggest reason to buy a Pixel. To me the Pixel is android competitor to the iPhone because of Google's software support.
The very best Google phone out on the market. Camera and the software makes great pictures & video. Noticeably smaller than the previous XL variants.

I came from my Pixel 2 XL to the Pixel 5 and I'm not disappointed. Same size screen for a more compact phone. The battery life is amazing and everything runs smooth on this phone. Best android experience of any other phone in my opinion.

At first I was kind of disappointed Google did not approach the Google pixel 5 like it did to the previous model where they had a very flagship version of it very high-end. I switched from my Galaxy s20 plus and honestly I have no regrets especially for the price. Very solid phone.

Upgraded my wife from a Pixel 2. She really seems to like it. The screen is nice and the phone is comfortable for her to hold. The phone is well built and runs fine for her needs, even on the mid-tier processor (765G). If you are coming from a Pixel 3 or 4, this is honestly less of an upgrade.

Fantastic smartphone for the money... Definitely a worthwhile upgrade without sacrificing on the screen. Upgrading from a Pixel 4XL I just feel this Pixel 5 is more portable and easy to handle. Not having facial recognition is not as big a deal as I thought it would be. The fingerprint reader is fast, zippy and more discreet. Finally, the fact that it's waterproof and dust proof is one of my minimum requirements.... Check.
I have had Google Phones since the early days of Nexus devices. The Pixel 5 does not disappoint. I usually purchase the XL variant however I am finding the size of this device to be very refreshing.
Good phone. Sound effects are loud and unable to be turned down.

Bought this unlocked so I can keep my phone bill lower. Will have to purchase all my phones unlocked now. This was simple to get and then switch over to my service days later. The battery life on this thing is amazing too!

EXCELLENT - 
  
  phones have caught up to each and now it's about the software and safety and ease of use. The pixel was made for this
Pretty smooth device besides the in display speaker. Propel have issues hearing me but other than that performance is pretty good.
Great phone at a really good price. Better price than buying it through our carrier. And it was a quick and smooth transaction.

I am replacing a Samsung Phone with the Google Pixel 5. I am extremely HAPPY with the Google phone. Very fast compared to the Samsung and it does everything the Samsung did but better and faster. I am sure there is MANY more things that the Google phone can do that I am not even using, but I am VERY impressed with the Pixel 5.

I had a Google Pixel 3XL but needed to upgrade due to phone damage... I love the difference in speed in navigating from app to app and the 5g network capability. The only thing I don't like is the size. It's a lot smaller then my 3XL but other than that- the phone is fantastic.
Great phone. This is my second Google phone and have enjoyed them both.
My daughter loves this phone. It has a Great camera and is very easy to use and works with Google!!!!
Although screen is really tiny. The features of the camera and the speed of the cellphone makes it worth it.
Great phone. Great value. Photo quality is outstanding, and the default android experience that Google delivers is second to none.
It's a good phone with a great camera for the price.

Great phone, was hesitant to upgrade from my pixel 2 to this but glad I did. 5g service is more or less a gimmick on att now (5ge in Los Angeles area) but glad to have Wi-Fi calling support on ATT with this model pixel. Phone is responsive. Battery life is outstanding compared to my well used pixel 2. When I'd have to charge once in the middle of day with heavy usage I now find iPhone still at 60% or more left at the end of day. Screen quality is nice especially coming from the smaller screen diag of the pixel 2 with little change overall size/weight. I was originally concerned the back of phone material would be subpar to that of the pixel 2 but happy to report it feels fine and not cheap at all. I don't do cases/screen protectors on my phones and this phone feels robust and fine for that setup/use. Definitely a worth while upgrade from the pixel 2 to this pixel 5 even with what some might consider is a subpar processor in this.
It was a gift and they loved it. Very easy to use and customizable.

The pixel 5 is a good solid phone. I know many people point out at that this phone doesn't have the newest chipset but I notice no lag at all. It's fast and quick. The cameras are nice as advertised but as many other people have pointed out the volume is a issue. I think it's loud enough when watching YouTube and other apps but is fairly quiet for making calls even with the volume all the way up. The only other knock I have on the phone is that I can't screen mirror to my TV without WiFi. That's a pretty common feature on almost all phones nowadays and for $700 I think that's something that should be included. Other than that it is a very nice phone.

I upgraded to the Pixel 5 from the Galaxy S8 and the phone seems amazing so far. In terms of hardware, the biggest upgrade is the battery, which lasts much longer than my last phone. The software took about an hour to get used to, but once I was used to the interface, it seemed very natural. It has its ups and downs, but depending on how you use your phone, it can be very easy to get used to. 
  
  The largest reasons for getting this phone are for software and price since Google realize they can't compete with Samsung and Apple in terms of hardware specs. 
  
  The biggest problem I have is that it's the software doesn't naturally allow the user to re open background apps in the same way that the iPhone and the Galaxy phones would. It's been almost 6 years since I've used an iPhone and I currently use a Galaxy S8, but opening previous apps still seems relatively easy to do despite a difference in user interface

Taking some time to learn how to navigate the various menu choices. Comes with various guides as an app on the phone and as an e-mail that was sent. Still pleased I purchased it. Do like that the phone is "unlocked" which will enable me to change service providers should my current provider continue to jack up rates. Also, really like the size. Most new phones are too big to easily fit my hand or the leather phone belt pouch I have.

This is probably the best bang for your buck android phone on the market right now, Pure Stock Android, no bloatware, fast snappy phone and overall the best point and shoot phone out there for pictures, you'll love it.

A little disappointed. Screen isn't as responsive as my 2 was/is if they still supported the 2 I would be using it. Some reasons many sites still come up with "this ad has been removed due to your phone not meeting requirements." For the price and upgrading a 3 year old phone I would have thought I'd get a lot more. Time will tell how it goes.

So far I have been pretty happy with my Pixel. I know I don't use it as extensively as others who may be looking for a lot more bells and whistles, but the camera works great and has worked for all my needs. Also nice that it didn't break the bank and I just paid for it outright and not get caught up in another 2 year payment plan. 
  Nice change from my last Galaxy, just trying to get use to a little different set up.
Great product works as advertised. Have not had a single problem with this device.

Upgraded from my Pixel 2 XL I bought at launch. Phone's over all footprint is smaller than the XL but the screen is not noticeably smaller. It is a great phone and an improvement over the Pixel 2 XL. I do miss the ability to squeeze the phone for the Google Assistant. I never realized how much I used that until it was gone. 
  
  The phone does have a "bio resin" back (plastic) and it is not aluminum like the box says. It doesn't detract any points in my book but I just wish Google was more forthcoming with that. 
  
  The battery is the biggest feature for me. I can go twoish days on a charge with moderate to heavy usage. My Pixel 2 XL was a beast in this area but the 5 is just another level. Google really has the battery usage down really well.

Great midrange phone. Has most of the features of more expensive phones. The main difference I see, is that the processing time to do things like take a picture take slightly longer than what you'd expect.
Got this for a family member. Great phone, fast, 5G, and sturdy.
Small phone but it's great for one hand use. I had top of the line phones but this does a great job. Pure android and always gets the updates first.
My old Pixel was not holding a charge. I received the new Pixel 5 quickly before my old phone died completely. The Pixel 5 phone works great on my 4G cellular network.

A wonderful device from both a hardware and software perspective. The size of the device is refreshingly smaller than most behemoth phones out there, and the phone feels light, yet substantial. The display is incredibly crisp, and at 90Hz, it makes the entire user experience feel incredibly fluid. I wouldn't want to go back to a lower refresh speed again. 
  
  The camera quality is great, though there is some unexpected graininess when using the standard 2x zoom, but it's not bad enough to discount the overall incredible quality and feature-rich camera hardware and image processing software. 
  
  This really is just the best phone Android has ever had. Zero regrets.

There are lots of reviews talking about the price point of Pixel 5, and yet the phone may not be the best perf per price. However, coming from Pixel 2 XL, this is a definitely nice upgrade. I didn't notice any reported problems like volume control or the gap between the case and glass. Active dual-SIM standby is another great thing -- but you will be downgraded to 4G LTE in this case. So if you like Pixel, its simplicity and no clutter android experience, just go for it.
Son is bery happy ... Bought it with his birthday cash ... Although ... Was a bit of a issue when i payed ... But he is happy now.

Some people might think I am a little biased toward Google products since I am a long time Google fan! So far, I've been upgrading my phone every 2 year, sticking with the odd number edition. I started with Pixel, Pixel 3XL and now Pixel 5. 
  - 5G Speed: I am fortunate enough to live in San Diego where T-Mobile 5G is in majority places. I tested using Speedtest and it clocked in at 129Mbps download and 80.2Mbps upload! Impressive... 
  - Camera: what Google lacks in physical lens, it makes up in its software. 
  - UI: clean and no bloatware. Having said that, there are many new gestures that I am still getting used to. Given that I am switching over from Pixel 3XL, it's a bit surprising at the differences in the gestures. 
  - Storage: 128GB, Google does this right! 
  - Screen: When I switched from Pixel to Pixel 3XL, I remembered how happy I was to get more screen real estate, but there was always struggle in tucking my phone into my jeans front pocket. (I am 5'2"). Now, going back to 6", it's really hard to scale back again. I really wish Google offered Pixel 5XL this year. 
  - Back cover: the material is a bit more plasticky than the smooth rubbery feel in Pixel 3XL. 
  
  Overall, at $699, I'm getting a super speedy phone with huge storage and the latest and greatest from Google line up. I am glad I stick with Google's flagship phone one more time!
The pictures alone on this phone are amazing. The phone is easy to work with as I was an Applie person prior to this purchase. I was afraid it would take forever to get around in the Apps.
I just love pixel, would not go back to any other brand

We have two Pixel 5's, have had every other generation of Pixel. Rally like thee sorta sage color (my wife's). We don't have a case on them, they have held up well to a couple small drops. 
  
  Just a good, solid, working phone.
Best phone I've purchased thus far. Works great with the Google ecosystem.
Got this phone for my birthday - Love it! Great features, beautiful pictures. More functions than I have had the time to learn yet.
Great phone, much smoother than my Pixel 2XL. Highly recommended.
I like Pixel Phones just wish Google came out with an XL version. But it's a very good phone for the price.
excellent easy to use , pictures are phenomenal crystal clear
Best phone I've ever used so far. It's speed, design, quality and size and packaging is amazing.
Phone works great. I have not had any problems at all.

This is my 3rd Pixel phone. I feel it was a good upgrade from the aging Pixel 2 XL. I am glad to have a smaller frame phone now, but the screen is almost identical in size to the Pixel 2 XL due to the minimal bezels. Battery life has been outstanding getting me through the day with plenty of charge to spare. The only gripe I have is the under screen speaker is a bit lacking, but not a deal breaker by any means.

Love this phone so far. Great battery life, awesome pictures, and love the fact that they still have the back index finger sensor for unlocking and swiping down the notification shade. Android perfection!

I received the Google Pixel 5 5G at no cost for an honest review. 
  My first impressions are good. The phone is very light to hold with smooth curves, but it is not slippery due to its lightly textured matte rear surface. The rear feels slightly plastic-y but not quite to the point where it feels cheap. 
  I was able to easily transfer most of my apps and settings with a guided process using an included USB-C cable. Coming from a different android phone, transfer was painless and took 8 minutes (50gb). After that, all the apps automatically downloaded and the Pixel was looking familiar again. 
  The fingerprint reader almost blends in with the back, and in my first few days of usage I kept accidentally touching the camera lens while searching for it. 
  The screen on this phone is beautiful. Watching even 1080P UHD videos on it is mesmerizing. The colors are vivid and true to life. The only caveat is that the front camera lens will be on the corner when you decide to expand your video to fill the whole screen. 
  Phone calls were normal, without anything to report. 
  Night photos with minimal light were beautiful. In fact, in the Pixel 5, I’d say the best feature is the camera (you could probably write a big manual on camera settings alone). With 12mp and 16mp ultrawide, you can get some large shots in, even at close range. In particular, I found the ability to do wide photos and wide selfies without having to move the camera handy. 
  One of my gripes is in fact the physical design of the camera on the phone itself. It sticks out of the phone, which means when you lay it on the counter with the screen side up, the camera lens will make contact with the surface (at least the bottom of it will). This is particularly annoying for those of us who don’t like to use cases. Placing the phone face down may not be a better solution either, but at least it’s completely flat on the screen side. This just means I’ll have to get a case. 
  My other minor gripe is the sound quality. Not that I expect much from cellphone speakers, but considering this is Google’s only phone, I expected better. Music sounds nasal in general. By the way, no headphone jack, if you care to know. 
  In terms of performance, the phone delivers and it is extremely responsive, even with 169 apps that I loaded on it. I like that it comes with 128 gigs, but I don’t like that it is not expandable. It has 5G and while I live in an area of California with AT&T 5G, I must say that there was no difference for me in terms of 4G and 5G speeds. I did not go in depth and only performed simple download/upload tests, so this may require more testing. 
  I noticed that every once in a while, the Wi-Fi would drop within my house. I’ll have to test it out more, but it was only happening with this phone. 
  Lastly, the battery did last me a few days with normal use, and, while I did not field test it, I can say that it is more efficient that anything I’ve used in the past, especially considering the small size of the phone. 
  Overall, I would recommend it, keeping in mind that it’s plenty for most people. However, if you like premium features such as heartrate sensors or a more premium-feeling shell, I’d go a different route.
This phone is so underrated , this is perfect great camera!! Best if Android.
Very good phone, over all it does everything I need it to and more. Would definitely recommend to those that want to get a nice phone but don't want to spend over a grand.

An excellent phone. I found the default nav settings (gestures) frustrating and screen framing was a little off but a quick search pointed me to restoring android defaults and all is good. Phone is fast and great battery life and I love the 5g.
Pixel gold standard. Stock Android, long battery. Bezeless

I love the phone! I upgraded from Google Pixel 2. However I did reduce a star for quite a few things I didn't like: Audio quality is Very Poor (I'm glad I bought the pixel buds because the speakers on this phone are Not Good especially compared to my old phone). I don't like these new gestures that replaced the soft back button (I end up swiping and incidentally deleting things when just trying to go back to the last page - since the gestures are identical), and last but biggest peeve Google Maps doesn't work (Waze works but Maps doesn't and I'm wondering did I just get a bad model?). Other than that I totally love the phone (Camera, battery life, video quality, *speed is comparable to Pixel 2, wireless charging, long list of latest Android things), just wish the audio and gestures were better so I could give it 5 stars, also wish I knew why Google Maps doesn't work on a Google phone. I'd still take this phone over any other phone on the market today as you can read all the other positive reviews for all the great impressive features.
Works so much better than the Pixel 3a which this phone replaced.
This is a solid phone for anyone. It may not be the highest spec device but it gets the job done and comes with plenty of creature comforts that people will love.
ordered two, one came in a day and the other one was lost in transit. However, Best buy Customer Service was great and got me the phone within a day.

I've been pixel use for years, and a nexus user for even longer. There's nothing better then vanilla Android. The pixel line, while not touting the newest or best processors, proves that optimization can out perform brute strength. The camera is phenomenal and battery life is the better then I expected. I will say the green color for whatever reason is more slippery than the black color.

The Pixel 5 is not as powerful as the Pixel 4. I handed my Pixel 4 down to my parents and bought the Pixel 5. The 5 loses the earpiece speaker the 4 had. The 5 is not as good at playing audio directly from the phone as the 4. Sound is still good. 
  
  I do like the fingerprint unlock on the 5 instead of the facial unlock of the 4. It's way handier than a face unlock in the pandemic wearing a mask. 
  
  The camera is good, but not my Nikon D750. The battery life is fantastic. I use Google Fi for service and that's as good as ever. I don't find many 5G signals where I live.

Not happy with the phone. No happy with Google.

It's very upseting to spend $700+ on a new phone that broke in a few months and not get a brand new replacement. The only thing I like about this phone is the pictures it takes that's all folks.

Coming from a Pixel 2 XL... This phone is tiny. 
  It runs so smooth, has an awesome camera, battery life and decent screen. But it was too small for me (am a trucker and need it for maps) so I returned it and bought a OnePlus 8 PRO. Far superior and big enough for my needs.

700 dollar hole in your pocket.. 
  Don't buy. Overheating issues phone feels so flimsy its sickening and the $700 Price tag is this out of the question The phone Made from plastic it feels light it doesn't feel like a 700 phone I will not recommend , but I do recommend the pixel 4a.
