Nice size phone with good responsiveness for email, web, video and apps. Pictures taken are excellent and no issues with taking good videos either. Not being used for gaming so no comment on its performance there. Got a good price on an unlocked phone from BestBuy so its value was excellent. Battery life is good for a couple of days under typical use and wireless charging is nice to have.

I went to this store because the one I just to have close to my house was close, but I had a bad experience with this sales guy, super rude and very hard to understand him, he makes us feel like he discriminate us , we paid with two different cc the two phones that we purchased and he just added one to my best buy account. He didn't even bother himself to asked us if we needed anything else, cases or the screen protector, wow ...can someone help me please and put the second phone on this account. Thank you.
Wish I would have stuck with my old pixel. This one is terrible, screen constantly doesn't work and apps are very lagged.

It's not the fastest phone, but the build quality is nothing to complain about. For the price as Google's flagship phone it's nice for once not to pay $900+. The hole punch camera noticeable-ness does go away after time.
SO FAR A REALLY NICE UPGRADE FROM MY PREVIOUS PHONE. I LIKE THE SCREEN SIZE AND COLORS

Android user here and 4 months in. It's way too expensive for what this is. Camera is good but not as hyped up as fanboys make it to be. Battery is excellent! Screen is too dim! Speakers are underwhelming. Screen is too dim! Size is what I convenient (coming from a Note 9!). Screen...it's too dim... Software lacks features and it's buggy. Pure android is no longer the standard for a good android experience I am sad to say. 
  
  I will probably use this until the end of 2021 after the next set of Pixels, Notes, and oneplus are released but I don't recommend it.

Overall, this is a great phone in terms of the camera, screen resolution, responsiveness, and the UI. The battery life lasts a solid day with realistic usage, like texts, emails, Reddit, some youtube, and other assorted apps. 
  
  The major downside is making calls on it. They put the main speaker behind the screen on the top, so it sounds extremely hollow and downright awful. 
  
  I think this phone is better than most, and its built pretty well, so I think it'll survive a couple of years of realistic use and abuse before it starts to break apart. I can recommend this phone

Loved my pixel 2. Love my pixel 5 even more ! Great phone not "the best of best of the best sir with honers" but pretty close. Plus its a Google phone which means updates updates updates sir with honors .

Do not buy this or any other Pixel phone under any circumstances. They are hardwired to link to your PC's WiFi network and interfere with any application that employs the microphone -- especially Zoom and other teleconferencing apps. (The mic on the Pixel interferes with the mic on your PC, creating reverb/echo.) 
  Moreover, you can't make a phone call using your Pixel anywhere within the 30-foot WiFi radius for the same reason.
Great phone, pure Google operating system all the way
The phone I have been waiting to get in stock finally. Only problem is they don't have any phone cases or screen protectors for this phone
Great phone. I like the brand name. Its trouble free.

Good phone, best for receiving timely security updates and other improvements. Unlocked means I can take it anywhere, but I'm sticking with my current carrier. 
  
  Slightly smaller than Pixel 4 XL, but lighter in the hand and has great battery life. Camera seems pretty good (I'm not much of a shutterbug), Also works with my old Samsung Galaxy Buds bluetooth earbuds with no issues. Works great with that Google Pixel Stand and charges quickly--even in the Spigen case!
Gets some getting used to the screen sensitivity. Outside of that a great perchase.

Aside from expandable storage and the price, Google got everything right with this phone. If it was priced $100 cheaper, at $599.99, it would be perfect. Some users have reported screen gap issues, however I got lucky with this device, no issues here. I would say this is the best Google device since the Nexus 5; it's easy to recommend once you get past the price. Side note, audio quality when watching media isn't the greatest but it gets the job done.
Great phone. Takes a little getting used to after a Samsung. The battery life is awesome. Would definitely recommend this phone to anyone. Has that Samsung beat.

This is my third Pixel (1,3,5) and would recommend it over and over. Good Android experience. The best photo software (would like to see an upgrade to the hardware) and the 5 had the back finger print recognition. Love it.
Still learning. Needed to do a tutorial because of the difference between pixel 2 and this one.
Perfect size, awesome battery life. Super fast... great resolution...if you're looking for a phone for great pictures this is the one
Battery life is good. The new anti-shake modes built into the video software are phenomenal. I switched from iPhone 11 pro max.

The Google pixel 5 is a great device with software experience is very clean and pure navigating the Android u I is joy the battery was awesome it lasted me all day and then some this device is the size at 6" and very light weight comes with charger and brick unlike other phones purchase and it you will not be disappointed

I was skeptical before getting this phone due to the smaller size and the last generation internals (chip etc). However a couple months in, I have been impressed with the performance. The phone is super responsive and very fast. The size has grown on me as well as there is still plenty of screen real estate for watching videos and browsing the web. All in all, the phone does not boast the most impressive spec sheet but it performs spectacularly under everyday use. The only downside is the fingerprint scanner sometimes is not as responsive as I'm used to.
It's a great phone. It's very fast and a very welcome upgrade.

With this being my second Pixel, I know what was in store. Is the Pixel 5 a true flagship? No, not in my opinion. There are phone with faster processors, bigger batteries, and perhaps, even a better camera. But I love the "vanilla" stock Android experience and the lack of annoying bloatware that other phones have. I like the size as well. Coming from a Pixel 3a XL, this 6" phone almost felt small. The battery life is excellent and even though the camera hardware is dated, it still takes outstanding photos.

LOVE mine. There is no "screen gap" defect that has been mentioned around on social media. Love the new swipe left feature instead of the back button. Screen is same size as the 2XL but the phone itself is much smaller - fabulous! Extremely fast charge and battery lasts more than a day or 2 with heavy use. Old phone information was easy to transfer everything over and didn't leave anything out.

finally had the chance to have google pixel 5, been wanting to get this phone, friend of mine loved the camera that I told
  myself maybe once the new pixel comes out imma jump on the bandwagon! was it worth it switching from iphone let’s find out! 
  
  Pros
  - oddly enough coming from iphone for 6 years going back to android phone was pretty easy getting used to, first of all my personal work phone is an android device , having the new pixel 5 and the OS feels right at home
  - the outer design of pixel 5 was simple, man the back texture I thought it was weird at first, but it’s fantastic! the rough texture on the back makes you grip on the phone a lot better than smooth design like apple would have had
  - Pixel 5 feels lighter than my previous iphone 10 as well, having the tiny hole for front facing camera is a lot more pleasing that iphone notch
  - main reason I switch to android is to able to play Xbox Xcloud, my area does support 5g and my goodness, the jump on speed helps a lot on gaming on the go, I barely lag playing through cloud, the delay is very minimal. 5g signal help me a lot when using remote play on my xbox console to play on the go, using 4g on my previous iphone x, using remote play the audio of the game sounded so terrible and low quality, with 5g it boosted al that for better experience, 5g is the future! 
  - let’s talk about the camera coz the camera on Pixel 5g is amazing, the color is balance, it doesn’t look saturated like I see on samsung phone, this probably the main thing I was excited to finally try, taking picture at night is way better than my iphone x , self portrait looks clean and way more controlled blur compared to iphone x. this phone also have ultra wide shot, I don’t remember having this on my iphone x so it’s a first for me! 
  - snapdragon is pretty fast smooth, didn’t notice any slow from testing the speed form scrolling to switching and opening/ closing apps
  - for the price of pixel 5 and the features you get compare to more high end phones is amazing! 
  - battery experience on this phone is great, this phone last longer than my previous phone! i’m on my phone a lot, so having this long battery life it helps on experience having this phone
  
  Cons
  - the audio of this phone is prob the main thing that bother me, it reminds me of Sony OLED tv where the screen audio is inside the glass, but my older iphone X had a much louder sounds than this pixel 5, like why did they choose to do this? it’s actually terrible specially if you put it side by side to a different phone, I could prob get a cheaper phone than pixel 5 and would find something that it’s way better quality than this. very disappointed. 
  - Snapdragon 765g is great and all but in 2020 I would hope for a better processor, maybe they trying to balance a price difference but still maybe i’m just being too picky 
  - you might want to re think buying this phone coz you pretty much will have the exact same experience when buying Pixel 4
  
  you prob ask why not just buy iphone 12 when they both the same price? i’m a huge gamer and when iphone announced that xcloud was not gonna be supported, I had to switch to an android phone, but this phone is fantastic! it’s easy to use, comes with great features that I need, and I doubt I would miss switching back to apple.
Great Phone with all the bells and whistles - also great service at Best Buy! Very Accommodating!
love this phone - wish I had switch over from apple years ago
I'm loving the camera and the great screen resolution! Still working out the new system after having a Samsung for years!
Great phone with a great price tag. Love this phone and how quick and fast it is. Best camera in my opinion.

Coming from a pixel 3 xl was a huge change in the screen size and the heft of pixel 3. However, the light Pixel 5 with its long-lasting battery does not make me miss the extra screen size. 
  
  The Bad recording at 60 fps in 4k tends to overheat the phone 
  The good recording 60 fps in 4k

Wasn't sure if I was going to like this phone after hearing a lot of mixed reviews, mostly regarding the hardware specs. I'm coming from a Pixel 2, which I really loved but the battery is on its way out. I LOVE my Pixel 5. The speaker may not be the best, but a Bluetooth speaker or headphones is $30 tops and WAY better sound than any smartphone on the market. The screen is crisp, the OS is smooth and clean, it does everything I want it to and nothing I don't (no bloatware like a lot of other Android phones), and the fingerprint sensor is back!!! No regrets whatsoever.
The phone felt cheap and the battery life was abysmal.
Great phone! and I'm just filling up the minimum characters.
This is such a nice phone! Fast, smooth, GREAT camera, and really nice screen.

I've had this phone for exactly one month and have already had issues with this phone. The phone periodically doesn't recognize my fingerprint. The screen has frozen up on me numerous times and for some reason it shut down and got stuck on the reboot loop for about 45 minutes. It's past my 14 days to exchange but I wish I could exchange for something different. These are too many problems for it to be brand new and newly purchased.
Best phones for Google assistant. Top of the line and the color is awesome too.
I enjoy using this sleek cellphone. It has a fine design and nice specs. The quality of the product is decent as well and the price was reasonable.
Looks good,felt good, but... couldn't use the device because they couldn't unlock it from the previous user.

It's compact! Really nice screen, great battery life (finally), and good performance. Helpful Assistant features. Great cameras, especially at night. There's 5G support, water resistance, NFC, and wireless charging, plus you get three years of security and Android version upgrades.
Excellent camera, best call quality. easy accessing menus.
Great phone! Switched from pixel 2XL and it was so easy!
Should be $100 cheaper with specs of a mid range phone but stocked heavy with google apps having no bloat ware from phone service providers. #TeamAndroid

This phone has amazed me beyond words. Scrolling through social media and browsing apps are super smooth. I got this for the camera and all i have to say is get this phone. The video camera is the best video i have seen and some really amazing slow mo cameras.
No issues with the phone. Came to the home as expected in good condition. Very seamless transaction and activation. Camera is the best!
Best android phone I have ever owned! Gotta love google!

You can't go wrong with the Pixel 5. I am very pleased with this phone. I still have the Iphone SE 2020 which I will now trade in. Before the SE I had the Pixel 4xl which I gave to my father. I decided to get the Pixel 5 over the Iphone 12/12 mini and the galaxy s20 Fe and the galaxy s21. I made the right choice. Again, the Pixel 5 is a beautiful phone. Buy it without any hesitation. Thanks
Love this phone but hate where the back button is and the close all tabs button whatnot is it's the only issues I have with this phone but it's a great phone overall
Best Pixel phone yet. Waiting for next year to see what they come up with.
Love the feel of phone, switching over from iPhone, was simpler than I thought it would be. Still getting use to small differences.
While I wish their was a Pixel 5XL this year , the 5 is still a great device. Good build quality and a great screen. Always the best software experience compared to other Android devices.
I love this phone. Camera is amazing. Getting used to going "back" on the phone is difficult. But overall performs well
Google pixel makes an excellent phone. This is the newest model and goes far above and beyond what was expected. Very happy with the phone and would definitely recommend buying it.
Honestly loving this phone. Its a bit different than my Samsungs Ive been devoted to for years but I like the differences. It holds a charge all day!! I use it heavy and its holding up to my demands!

This is my first Pixel and I have to say that I'm really impressed. For a device not running a flagship 800 series processor, it's really fast and responsive, probably due to that 90 hertz refresh rate. Honestly, I don't think the average person will know or care given the stock Google software experience that's not slowed down or bloated with a bunch of extra apps or thick skins. My biggest problem was getting the 3 months free of YouTube Premium. I still don't have it and I called YouTube support and everything. Not really helpful and no resolution. Still a great phone though.
Fast, Intuitive. Although it's plastic backed, it doesn't feel cheap. Screen is vibrant, pictures are great.

I received this item for giving a honest review. It seems like a very nice phone out of the box ii smaller than my current phone but I like it better too. It was easy to set up and get started. I used this as my primary phone and my carrier has 5G here and was able to get a 5G signal. It was fast and make me wish I had purchased my own. All things considered it is a very good phone takes good pictures has good reception and looks nice. I would buy this for myself . This phone also came with the latest Google Software.
Great phone. I have had many Pixel phones and this does not disappoint. I like that they reduced price for this new release. Only issue is the sensitive edges easily close windows when scrolling.

I've been using iPhones since their original release and occasionally tried Android phones here and there. In my younger years, the fomo of not having iMessage and FaceTime locked me into using Apple products for many years. I was using the iPhone XS Max before getting this device and my wife is using the iPhone 12. 
  
  Enough history, now about the device. 
  
  The 90hz display and minimal hole punch for the selfie cam is both a delight to use and look at. I was absolutely tired of the notch. Speaking of the notch, face ID during COVID was extremely annoying while wearing face masks. I genuinely really appreciate that Google went back to finger print scanners and ditched the face unlock from the pixel 4. Battery life is 10/10, I went 32 hours on one charge with 6.5 hours of screen time. I couldn't kill the phone if I tried. Also, the Google specific assistant features like call screen, auto hold, and other features are godsend with all these spam calls I keep getting. Most of my family have iPhones but over the years transitioned to whatsapp so I no longer worry about not having iMessage. I used to care about it for work, but after being stuck home, everyone now uses Zoom and MS Teams so I finally broke free from apples walled garden. As a father, husband, son and even business professional. Life's too short to use a device just to please other people. Pictures are excellent and still don't know how these night photos work. Dont worry about the snapdragon 765 as it performs so well I don't even notice a performance difference between this and the 8xx series snapdragons. No I'm not paid to write this review lol.
1st Pixel I've ever owned. Replacing a 3 year old Moto. I like the size of the 5a, perfect for my small hands. I also like modern speeds. Easy to transfer from old Droid. The simplicity is elegant.
Great product. Slick design. Great look and feel..
This phone is excellent and was easy to migrate from existing google pixel phone to new Google pixel 5. Very happy with the purchase and the customer service I received from best buy.
Another hit in the Pixel line of phones. East transfer tool, great display and overall a great upgrade from my Pixel 2. 5G is a nice addition too
Love this phone, coming from a Samsung s10 -- much better camera, battery is amazing, size is perfect.
Upgraded from a Pixel 2 and I love it. The battery life alone is worth it

This is my second Pixel and wow what an upgrade! I had great service at Best Buy, too. I usually always go directly to Verizon for an upgrade, however, I couldn't resist the early Black Friday deals that started. This device is fast, sleek, and the upgraded camera is amazing. Highly recommend!

I was concerned about the 765 CPU in the Pixel 5, but after 3 months I think it is plenty fast. I don't play games on my phone, so that might be a consideration. I wanted to stay with a Pixel phone for the clean Android experience and timely updates (this phone replaced a Pixel 2XL). I did want a larger screen, but I'm not disappointed with my purchase and would recommend it to others.
I have always loved Pixel Phones, this phone is almost everything I wanted. I sure miss those front speakers though.

Overall, I've been loving my Pixel 5. Coming from the Pixel 2 XL, the updates made to the camera software and Assistant integration are immediately noticeable. 
  
  While I wish Google had offered a flagship option with better specs, this little phone hits harder than I expected. 
  
  The battery life is beyond expectations. Having been used to being tethered to my charger, the Pixel 5 can last for days at a time before hitting battery saver with lighter use, and can coast through overnight from 90->45% with several hours of SOT, and always-on display. 
  
  My biggest gripe is the removal of the squeeze for assistant (active edge?)... far more intuitive to me than the swipe from corner gesture to activate the assistant.
So far, so good. I had to upgrade from the Pixel 1 finally and held out for the Pixel 5. 5G is becoming available in more and more locations around me, so the speed is great.

This phone is a great, lower-priced, smaller option to the larger, more expensive flagship phones. It does everything you could really need it to do. The camera is great. Holds battery charge fairly well, and it is pretty fast. All in all, a really nice phone.
Great phone with excellent camera capabilities. Nice and compact size.
Looks sharp, lots of memory. Difficult to get used to screen actions with no hard buttons for back or home. Not any bloat wear which is a plus.
So far, I love the phone. Great feel with metal body; I love the Android OS; sound quality is good; video quality is good. I like it a lot.

Coming from a Pixel 1 XL, this has much smoother performance. I don't mind the 765 processor/chipset, the 8 GB of RAM keeps apps loaded for fast task switching. At 6" it is a bit smaller, but refreshing to be able to reach across the screen with a thumb, one handed. I did go to the store and handle the phone first, to make sure it wouldn't be too small. I get fast WiFi and mobile data speeds, it has not over heated, and that 1/10 mm gap in the top left corner is nothing, especially once it's in a case. I also considered a couple of other phones, but long term security/software updates was the final deciding factor. So far, so good. I hope to have it as long or longer than I had the Pixel XL.

It's what you expect. A pure experience of Android, easy to use, and a great camera. The camera is second to none, and not having a true optical zoom lens has not hurt the quality of the photos, (yet). If you are looking for top of the line components, this is not the phone for you. It does lag when processing pictures. It may lag at times when opening certain apps as well, when compared to the top of the line Samsung phones. If you can be patient for 2 seconds, it's worth it for me. It helps that I got it on Black Friday for $200 off, so I feel like it was worth it at that price point.

I had an iphone 7, but chose to upgrade to the Pixel 5 instead of the newest iphone based on 2 things: 1. Google claimed to have a better camera, which I agree with and 2. price. It was $400 cheaper than the latest iphone. That being said, next time I upgrade I will be going back to the iphone. It is more user friendly. Managing notifications and other settings seems to be more cumbersome on this device. I also liked the free unlimited photo storage Google offered, but one month after I got set up they put limits on storage, so I'm almost maxed out on that.
Best Buy provided the best price, by far, on a new Pixel 5. Easy to purchase and add to already existing Verizon plan. Thanks!
Wasn't a fan of this phone. Battery life is very bad when using several applications for business. Returned it for Samsung S21+

So fast and responsive. The battery life is way better than my pixel 3xl and the camera is the best on the market. Male sure to update everything as you want have the right experience till you do. Lots of updates needed out of the box.
love this phone they moxed features of the 4 and 3 pixel to make this a perfect blend. bring back the finger scanner and still keeping the swipe function to back out of windows is awsome.
My hubby loves this phone. However it’s smaller than the past ones but he went with it anyway because he loves google.
Overall good phone, nice upgrade from pixel 3, few things different, battery life so far is good to great.

I have always loved the pixel experience, had my pixel 3 for two years but wanted an upgrade for the battery, this one last the whole day, haven't had any issues whatsoever, the camera is outstanding and the software is great.
Very pleased with the phone. Love the camera and love how simple it is. Highly recommend.
Awesome phone. Had a 2xl and upgraded. Only wish it was XL, but I'm still glad. Battery will last for 2 day w minimal use. Purchased on black friday so I save $200+trade in 2XL

Okay we have iPhones and we have Samsung flagships but I think Pixel is very overlooked with flagship smartphones. This phone is awesome and reliable. this phone does everything any other smartphone would do but at a cheaper price point and the phone is loaded with features. I'm learning something new everyday that this phone does and I would recommend this phone to anyone. I get it it's hard to break up with Apple or Samsung but this would be a great transition for anyone.
If you like Pixels you'll like this phone. Not flashy, but clean and snappy. The camera's still great.
bought for $500 so well worth it! but occasional loss of signal with Verizon. unlimited photo/video storage main selling point for my wife! great camera overall!
Easy to set up. Very intuitive. I especially like the auto spam feature with texts and robot calls.

I was reluctant to put my Pixel 2XL out to pasture, but with the imminent expiration of system and security updates for that model, I could no longer postpone an upgrade. After researching the available options, including the more expensive flagships that offered more impressive specs, I decided to stay with the Pixel line based on my personal experience with the 2XL, which was the most reliable, user-friendly phone I've ever owned. 
  
  I looked at the Pixel 4a5G because it was larger, but ultimately opted for the Pixel 5. Having used it now for about 10 days, I can say without qualification that it has surpassed my expectations. It works flawlessly, takes fabulous photos, and provides a full two days plus on a single battery charge. While some users have reported lower sound quality and volume, mine has been fine -- just as good as my old P2XL. I highly recommend this device.
Pure Android is exactly what you get with the Pixel 5. Is it the perfect phone, no, but at this price point, it's exactly what you need to accomplish your googley lifestyle.
This phone is a workhorse. All day battery, adaptive settings to suit your life. Tough shell. all the features you want and only the features you need. Not over priced and yet, flashy
Battery life is amazing. I started the day with 100% battery and after 16 hours of heavy use, I was still left with 30-40% every time!
Love this phone!!! I've had other brands but this is by far the easiest to use. This phone is so underrated.

I am really enjoying the Pixel 5, huge battery life, nice screen. Audio is a touch wonky but not a big deal. I'm very happy to have this phone after my OG pixel XL. 
  
  The phone reports it will last a day and a half on my usage.
Great phone at a great price. upgraded from a pixel 2xl and man what a difference. Same screen size but way smaller phone.
I am very happy with the Google Pixel 5. The staff at Best Buy in Montrose, Ohio always make a phone purchase as quick and easy as possible.
Love this phone. Upgraded from a pixel 2. Don't think I'll be purchasing another brand again. Great amazing, fast and plenty of storage.

Very fast, very simple. The Google Assistant and Google UI really makes the difference here compared to other phones at this price point. 
  Technically a slight sacrifice on hardware for the price, but I have yet to notice it.

I have been using Samsung phones for about 8 years (most recently had the S9) and decided to jump ship to Google. The phone feels nice in my hands, less plastic-y than Samsung phones. I like that the phone is not too large. The battery life has been great so far. The camera is excellent and selfie photos are surprisingly decent. I was quite impressed with Night Sight. I like that there is less bloatware than my previous Samsung phones. 
  
  I have my phone in a case and decided to put a Pop Socket on the back. With it collapsed, I can actually still unlock the phone with my fingerprint even though I can't get close contact because of my curved fingernails. 
  
  Overall, very happy with my new phone and would recommend!
Great product and great service with Best Buy. I really like the battery life, quality and performance.
Great phone. Would recommend to others, battery last, already dropped and it didn’t crack or break.
Pixel works great! Good battery life and very fast.
Purchased for my son, an amazing phone! He loves the phone!
Great phone. Takes great pictures. Good size. Has 5G capability.
This is my third Pixel phone. This is thinner, faster, and has a longer battery life. I wish it had a headphone jack, but I knew it didn't when I bought it. I can't knock it for my personal taste.
I have owned every pixel phone except for the four this one is a great improvement

Upgraded from the Pixel 3 and this phone is amazing. Camera takes amazing pics (important with a newborn) and the battery life is amazing. I'm not a power user but do use it a good bit and I've gotten two days out of the battery several times.
It's a great phone. Definitely worth the price tag.
Very slow internet speeds and not very good looking to be honest

Very nice smartphone. Great screen and fantastic camera. not as fast as the competing flagships. if the camera is the most important feature, then go with the Pixel 5. if you need more speed or expandable memory, go with the Samsung Galaxy S20 FE.

Upgraded from a Google Pixel 2 XL. While noticeably smaller, it's not too small, and runs and cleanly. Transferring data and apps was a breeze. Great charge hold. Just the simple upgrade I wanted. Only thing I dislike was the new UI functions, but they allowed the option to change it back to the original ones which I highly preferred
Smaller than my old Pixel 3 XL, but easy to get used to. Google seems to be focusing on software over hardware, and for me that's the way to go.
Bought this for my daughter due to samsung phones were out of stock. Sales guy had one and recommended it. She loves the phone. Ease of use.
I've had the Pixel 1, 3 and now 5. Each one being better than the last!
Nice features. A little disappointed that it is a lot like an iPhone. Kinda feel if I wanted an iPhone I would've got one. Wish they had more color options.
Really like this phone and camera. I owned a Pixel 3 before and loved it. This 5G phone and camera and software is great

I had a Pixel 3 before I bought the 5 and I couldn't be happier. It has a few nice updates, and is faster, without abandoning what made the Pixel great in the first place. It streamlines well with Google apps (obviously), user friendly, and the camera is awesome.
Switched from iPhone. No turning back. Love it so much

Works fast easy to use. Great camera. Had a pixel 3 before so not alot of difference that I have noticed. Only thing I hate is the back button is on the screen when you swipe from left to right, so there are alot of getting in and out of my email as I am deleting.
Takes great pictures. Love the google pixels. A little to get used to the change in navigation.

I am usually a true flagship kind of guy, so was worried when purchasing something with a mid-range chipset. I have not been disappointed. Battery life is amazing, with limited hang-ups on any app I use. Biggest issue is lack of dedicated image signal processor, meaning you have to wait to see some of the pictures taken.
One positive aspect is it's smaller than most new android phones but still easy to see/use.
Great phone so far!! Great battery life, lasts all day even rubbing google maps
loving my Pixel 5 - long battery life, great screen. My third Pixel - still happy I switched from Samsung
Got this phone for my daughter and she loves it, she really likes the picture taking quality.
Great quality pictures, small enough for woman's hands, good construction.

Finally a "flagship" phone that doesn't cost an arm and a leg, yet does everything you could want with a phone. Long battery life, great camera, couldn't be happier. Just wish there were more case options

One Week in. his phone replaced my Pixel XL. Data transfer was easy. The screen is larger but the phone is small and comfortable in my hands. Camera is fantastic overall I am so happy. We will see where I am in a year.
It is great how this phone holds a charge. Easy to use and has a great camera.

Of course, it's a great phone, that is also fast and can take doing multiple tasks at once, but I was also really impressed with the battery life. At night I don't even charge it because if you put the phone on extreme battery saver it will only use essentials apps like messages, phone, alarm, etc. I tested this and when I went to bed, my phone had a 78% charge and when I woke up about 7 hours later, it had about 77%. A really great phone that I don't even have to worry about dying on me.
very pleased, little smaller in hand but got use to it. Excellent camera, wonderful pictures!
Only had this phone for about 2 weeks now but I am loving it so far. Battery life is fantastic, getting 1-2 days with pretty heavy use. Coming from an OG Pixel so quite the step up.
GOOGLE PIXEL 5 WAS BETTER THAN EXPECTED. THE COLOR IS PERFECT.

Coming from a Pixel 3XL to a Pixel 5, I was excited. Temper your expectations, don't expect a flagship processor but know that you're getting a near perfect "it just works" phone. I don't play games, so the Snapdragon 765G didn't bother me too much. The phone symmetry is beautiful, uniform bezels, holepunch camera, form factor, and a nice textured back. The fingerprint sensor and the camera are the best in any device I have ever used. The camera sensor may be old but once you go Pixel, it's hard to use any other camera. The battery life is incredible and the standout feature of this phone. I got 8 hours of screen on time with a single charge, blew my mind. My 3 XL got like 4-5 hours max. The only negative is the speaker. There are two down firing speakers that sound fine, but another behind the glass screen and it sounds terrible. Overall, for users with no gaming requirements, it's a high recommendation. Stock Android for life. 
  Google, pls get a better processor for the next Pixel though.

I have loved every pixel that I've owned. This one is no different. The only real different between this phone and past pixels is the wireless charging feature. Also, your can use this phone as a wireless charger which is cool. I upgraded from the pixel 3xl. This phone is smaller but the display is pretty much the same size. They moved the speaker from the front of the phone to the bottom which I don't love but it's not a deal breaker. Activating and transferring all my apps and settings from my old phone was effortless. Overall I would recommend this phone to anyone.

Not impressed.

  Not impressed.
I was On the phone to long and not satisfied with outcome.

We purchased the Pixel 5 5G for my wife who is a home health nurse. The phone would have been nice but for 2 problems. The first problem is that every few callers would be unable to hear her, as if she had muted the call which she hadn't. This made doing her job very difficult. 
  The second issue was with the Bluetooth connection in her car. When listening to streamed presentations over the Camry's system the stream would pause every few seconds. This happened with music as well. We couldn't take a chance on this happening in another Pixel so we went with a Samsung.

Great phone. Love it. Switched from Samsung so not too big of a change, but I have always liked Google products. Some things are a little different, but manageable and it just takes some getting used to the differences.

I upgraded from the pixel 2 and I am so glad I did. The incredible battery life (2 full days between charges). Love the 90hz screen, the fantastic pure Android experience, and wonderful camera. Definitely recommend.
I love the Pixel line of phones and going from the 3XL to this is very nice. I wish there was an XL version. But I'm still ok with this one. The battery life is amazing.

For a $599 phone, it is amazing. I stepped up from a Pixel 2 XL and this has much better battery, I have gotten 3 days of my "very light" use, 2 days from my "normal" use, and a full day out of my "heavy" use. The Pixel 5 also has a much smoother screen (90hz refresh rate) that you can tell the difference when scrolling through stuff. The phone overall is smaller that my Pixel 2 XL which took a few days to get use to, especially when typing on the virtual keyboard but since I use swiftkey's keyboard, I was able to enlarge the keyboard slightly from what I typically have it set at, and now all is good. Keep in mind, even though the overall phone size is smaller, the screen size was almost identical to my last phone due to the very small bezel, just a different aspect ratio, no longer 16x9 but now more narrow. I am not the biggest fan of the punchhole front camera, but it has stayed out of the way thanks to the oversized status bar at the top. Which, by the way, is a waste of space, the status bar is twice as tall as it use to be which is to cover the area of the front camera. I wish they could have moved the camera up further allowing the status bar to be normal size. The back cameras are great, and using the wide angle lens for the first time in a narrow room, at first made the picture have a fish eyed look. But to my surprise, the phone adjusted the picture after taken and squared the room back up to look normal without distortion - very impressive. Now they need to include all 3 cameras like most other flagship phones have. While I don't play games on my phone, everything else is super fast and you would never know it doesn't have the highest end processer. 5G was not that impressive, but that is due to Verizon not the phone. Maybe one day we'll see faster speeds. Love having wireless charging again (my Samsung Galaxy S6 had it, and boy did I miss it on my Pixel 2 XL), I use wireless charging to save the USB C port from being overly used which will provide a longer life span without charging issues. Be sure to get a 14 or 15 watt wireless charger so you can take advantage to the faster wireless charging speeds. My biggest gripe is the transfer process to a new phone, Google needs to step up their game and when doing a full transfer of the apps, should sign all apps into your accounts. Very few apps auto signed in, and I had to manually sign-in, get 2-step verification codes, reset passwords, and even locked myself out of a few accounts. That process takes too long, and is a pain.
Upgraded from Pixel2 and liking everything about the 5. Great battery life!

To me, there is a singular reason for buying a Pixel phone: Software. The software experience on a Pixel device is simply unparalleled. Simple but thoughtful additions enhance the user experience. One of these features, call screening, is absolutely amazing. It's one of the most powerful tools in battling spam calls. The Pixel line has had a somewhat troubled history, but I think Google has made a wise decision in chasing value as opposed to industry-leading specs. While the Pixel 5 doesn't pack the latest processor, its performance is unquestionably more than capable for most users. The simplicity of the software combined with the 90 Hz display makes the Pixel 5 feel fluid and fast in everyday use. Additionally, Google seems to have finally taken battery life seriously. After the dismal battery life of the Pixel 4 lines, Google has sported the Pixel 5 with a much larger battery that, combined with the mid-range processor, makes this phone leave any battery life concerns in the past. While I liked face unlock with the Pixel 4, I find the fingerprint sensor on the Pixel 5 to be fast and accurate and, if I am going to use a fingerprint sensor, I much prefer it to be located on the back of the device rather than embedded in the screen (I actually miss LG's old approach of integrating the fingerprint sensor with the power button on the back of the phone). Not surprisingly, the camera is still impressive although, admittedly, the camera is one of the lowest priorities on a smartphone for me; But, if a good camera is a priority for you, you'll find it on the Pixel 5. The phone's design is a bit uninspired and utilitarian but, slap one of Google's nice fabric cases on it and the phone gets some personality. The screen is excellent - minimal bezels with a small hole punch camera on the left. Sound on the Pixel 5 is a bit underwhelming, and this is likely due to there being no true top speaker (google uses the screen itself as a speaker, much like LG did with the LG G8). Call clarity is perfectly fine, but music can sound a bit muffled - this is not a big deal for me because I used wireless headphones 99% of the time I listen to music. If you are looking for the latest hardware and top of the line specs, the Pixel 5 is not for you; but, if you are looking for an unparalleled software experience wrapped in a manageable form factor, the Pixel 5 is definitely worth a look.

This phone handles the rigors of data collection in post-fire operations, it can get wet with no problems which actually happens a lot, it can be dropped, which also happens a lot, it can get dirty, covered in ash, and it goes everywhere I do with barely a mark to show for it. I get better reception with this phone, sometimes I even find a few bars of 5G while working in the burn scar!

I've had this phone for a couple months now and am still in love with it. 
  
  No, it's not the fastest, flashiest phone ever, but it's never slowed down on me for what I use it for (messaging, web browsing, the occasional light game) and the battery is honestly darn near impossible to kill in a single day (I've done it, but it involved shamefully binging a mobile game for like 8 hours...). 
  
  The unmodified version of Android is snappy, clean and efficient. The camera is great, with an amazing suit of editing software that lets you tweak just about anything you could possibly want shy of importing the photo into adobe photoshop. 
  
  My favorite things though are the call screening via Google assistant means no more robocalls (yes, it is as blissful as it sounds) and the fact that I don't feel like I need a case for this phone. Yes, no case, no screen protector. This phone is durable. I've dropped it several times onto bare concrete floors at work several times and this ring doesn't have a scratch on it. 
  
  Downsides:
  
  No headphone jack (not a huge deal for me, but it's notable)
  
  Coming from a galaxy s10+, the screen feels small but I've gotten used to it. 
  
  The top speaker is behind the screen and doesn't sound particularly great, even as an earpiece for phonecalls (at high volumes not great turns into noticably awful).

While I am a fan of the Pixel Line, this Pixel 5 has such a bad Phone Speaker, that I had to return it. To help you understand, the "earpiece" for the phone speaker is under the glass of the phone. There is no external speaker! Therefore, when you are on a call and the other person is talking, the entire phone vibrates, making it VERY annoying to have a conversation. Also, because the speaker is under the glass, the sound for music, videos, etc. is also very poor. The bottom speaker is good enough, but gets muffled with the combo of the under glass speaker. The other features of this phone are why I originally purchased it, and they are what makes the Pixel my favorite phone. Unfortunately, this one HUGE design flaw made me return it. Sure hoping they fix this with the Pixel 6!

I've been a Pixel phone user for many years now and I'm very happy with this purchase. Everything is working well. The battery life is much better than previous versions. It took me a little bit to get used to the smaller size since I had always purchased the XL versions, but now it feels like just the right size.

I upgraded my old Pixel phone to the Pixel 5. The Good - the battery lasts much longer, lots of storage space (128GB), takes great photos, and a reasonable price. The Bad - the phone is buggy, the phone randomly resets volume to 100%, Android Auto and Google Assistant are buggy together (sometimes verbal instructions to call someone within AA don't work & asking the phone to read messages is hit and miss). But it's half the price of competing phones.
Don't listen to the naysayers- this phone is excellent! Great display, nice smooth operating system, and the best battery life I've ever had on a cell phone! Thanks Google!
From what the nay sayers are saying this is a good phone and I'm happy with it and it is much more snappy compared to my pixel 3 XL just wished it had Wi-Fi 6

After owning numerous versions of the Pixel line, I think Google finally got it right. The price makes sense considering the upper mid range processor which easily handles the way I use my phone; web browsing, YouTube and YTTV. Coming from the Pixel 4 I still consider this an upgrade. Battery life is amazing with about 6 hours of SOT compared to barely 3 hours with my Pixel 4 on a good day. I think Google better understands where they need to be; not top shelf flagship specs but an excellent device for the majority of people.
Great phone. Previous phone was a Pixel 3. Great battery, performance and amazing camera.

This phone is just like the reviews say. It is on a better budget than some other phones. It offers almost everything you would ask for in a phone. Offering water resistance wireless charging good storage and memory along with a couple of great cameras. I also like that the phone is not glass I am not sure who made up the premium market or who drives it but that is farce in my book. I think premium is something like this with grip a good clean look and something you do not have to worry about breaking easy. I also like how they finally slimed down the phone and fit a lot into a small package. I would have like to see a bigger screen because of it but I am ok with what this gives you. I am surprised at how good the audio works on this phone considering how it is produced. You would not know the processor is not the top end because this phone performs all day every day very very well. I also like that I use it every day playing games and work and still only charge it about every day and a half. I think the screen refresh rate and resolution are perfect again the companies trying to go bigger make no sense. This is not a tv and you can only see things up to certain specs and this is about it. It also helps the battery last longer which with how small this phone is I would be ok with it being a little thicker with a bigger battery to get a couple of days out of a charge. The only negative things I can say for the phone is I wish it did have the 3 cameras with wide normal and telephoto like others along with the option for a bigger screen.
The battery life on this phone is incredible. Very happy with this replacement for my Pixel 3.

I have had the phone a month now. It is working great! Takes awesome pictures and videos! There are so many features that this phone offer's, best one is the security features! This phone is worth every penny!

I bought the Verizon carrier-locked version when it was on sale for $500 and, I couldn't be happier! 
  
  This has been the perfect replacement for my Pixel 2. I have not experienced any slowness with the 765G and, the wide-angle lens has been great for both photo and video. 
  
  Additionally, it has fixed my number one issue with the pixel line, battery life. I can now comfortably take my phone off its charger and know it is going to last me 24+ hours. 
  
  Finally, I was relieved to see that, even on the carrier-specific version, there was no bloatware other than the Verizon account management app, which can easily be uninstalled. 
  
  I would highly recommend this to anyone not wanting to shell out $1000 for a new phone to pick this phone up.
I have been using pixel phones for years. just like before, I am satisfied with this phone. it is very user friendly
